list_definition.definition: to divide (something) among several (people); deal out

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He distributed sweets to all the children in the class.
Our shops are distributed all over the city.

list_ex_of_english: For example, welfare transfers are usually unequally distributed (most households do not receive them), but they are directed disproportionately at poor households.
Note that a schema, thus understood, is a functional unit and may be anatomically distributed throughout different structural brain regions.
The editor, apparently without a hint of irony, suggests that readers photocopy it and distribute the parts for singing.
Mutations are assumed to be independent and identically distributed across players.
The soil is shallow and patchily distributed on or between these various rock surfaces.
Random assignment would ensure that all unmeasured confounding factors were equally distributed between comparison groups.
Section 3.1 presents approximation results when the particles are uniformly distributed.
Table 3 presents parameter estimates of the effects of the political and economic variables on the amount of national subsidies distributed to each province.
